data.title: Multi-line editing becomes unusable with large selections
data.body: I've just tried to multi-line edit a file with 400 lines produced by `find .` All of lines the started with ./, so I selected the first ./, kept on pressing CTRL+D to capture them all. Around line 250-300, the editor would slow down a bit, but the selection finished quickly. Then I started typing a few characters, and the first took several seconds to appear, while the second didn't appear even after 30 seconds. That makes multi-line editing pretty much useless.

data.title: Umlaute not displayed correctly
data.body:
Atom is currently having issues with displaying umlaute (äüö).
When an umlaut character is typed or pasted it appears until the end of the line.

![screenshot - 011315 - 12 50 26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1491574/5720388/c0aaee9c-9b23-11e4-81f5-a0261557cb28.png)

When it is removed, everything looks just fine:

![screenshot - 011315 - 12 51 54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1491574/5720387/be19a90c-9b23-11e4-8c23-45bb4fc14037.png)

It also seem to be related to syntax highlighting, when selecting "Plain Text", everything is fine:

![screenshot - 011315 - 12 52 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1491574/5720385/bbe8efee-9b23-11e4-9185-d75cd153e118.png)

Issue found on Arch Linux, build 0.171.0-296409d
Working without issues on Windows.

Document is UTF-8.

Tested with Syntax Highlighting for C, C++, Javascript, Latex and PHP. (Might affect other languages too, but I did not test it. I believe every language is affected.)

data.title: Pasting multiple lines into the "find in current buffer" field
data.body:
Hi there, when I command + f and paste multiple lines into the "find in current buffer" field the lines seem to be pasted into the field but behind all the other ui elements. 

![example](http://i.imgur.com/mP4nZT7.png)
bug?

data.title: Deprecate old tab selectors
data.body:
Add deprecations in [atom-selector-linter](http://github.com/atom/atom-selector-linter). I believe the required updates are:
- [x] `.tab-bar` -> `atom-tab-bar`
- [x] `.tab` -> `atom-tab`

/cc @benogle. Are these right?

data.title: cmd/ctrl click URLs should open them in the default browser
data.body:
Similar to iTerm works, when you cmd+click a URL it opens in the default browser. Likewise, it would also be nice to have an "Open Selection as URL" in the right-click context menu.

Atom already underlines URLs in every language, so I imagine implementing this would be trivial.

data.title: Snippet with current date
data.body:
Is it possible to have a snippet insert the current date?

I was hoping to use the [date](https://atom.io/packages/date) package to do this, but it would seem that this is currently not possible.

laktak/atom-date#1

data.title: Add gutter-hidden attribute to atom-text-editor elements
data.body: This will be used by the next release of `markdown-preview` to render code blocks using editors instead of a secondary highlighting code path. This will enable the `.editor-colors` selector to be deprecated. Refs #5010.

data.title: Chocolatey Package out of date
data.body:
Am I right in saying that the chocolatey package for atom is maintained out of this repository?

I have noticed, via disqus comments:

https://chocolatey.org/packages/Atom#comment-1787917190

That the chocolatey package for Atom is quite a bit out of date.  Would it be possible to get this package updated?

data.title: Atom starts with no tabs, "dev tools" open on startup, unable to open files
data.body:
Version 0.170.0, 
Windows 8 Pro 64-bit

After the dev tools are closed you're unable to open any files. Atom lets me choose a file to open but nothing happens.

View on startup:
![atom_1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3340958/5709882/1ba84a52-9aa6-11e4-8298-5b7567a4d238.png)

View after I close the dev tools:
![atom_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3340958/5709890/29ef5754-9aa6-11e4-838c-c02bb9338d38.png)

No tabs visible, cant open files. New file or ctrl + n does nothing.

Could not find this issue from the existing ones, I apologize if it exists.

data.title: A little too heavy-weighted?
data.body:
I checked this issue list and it seems it is not a duplicate. I suppose this could be considered an enhancement request.

Atom is too heavy-weighted. Given all those features such as package management, even some support like a web-browser way, it should be alright. But taking the official release as example, they are approximately 100 Mb, which is almost the size of Firefox browser. I see for windows compilation, chromiumcontent.dll is the single biggest file, along with others. 

Is there any way or work goign on to slim down Atom a little bit more?

data.title: Deprecate .editor-colors selectors
data.body: This requires us to use some other strategy to style code blocks in the `markdown-preview` package. Our current thoughts are to just use read-only `atom-text-editor` elements. We need to add the ability to hide the gutter and make the editor read only before this will be possible.

data.title: Enter/Return Ignored
data.body:
I can't use my Enter/Return key in Atom.

OSX Yosemite
Version 10.10.1

MacBook Pro (13-inch, Mid 2012)
Processor 2.9 GHz Intel Core i7
Memory 8GB

data.title: Windows: make "Open with Atom" context menu a preference
data.body:
As discussed in #4987, the Atom installer installs a "Open with Atom" entry in the Windows Explorer context menu for every file and folder. It would be preferable, as @paulcbetts suggests, to have a prefence where it can be turned off or on entirely, or just for specific files and folders. For example, not many people will open images from Explorer with Atom.

@lee-dohm pointed out that the specific code which adds and removes the item is in https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/browser/squirrel-update.coffee.

data.title: Standalone TextEditor
data.body:
I tried to extract only text-editor component but it's difficult because of some native module and global properties(mainly atom.config). My purpose is to use instead of CodeMirror or use on other atom-shell project.

As far as I read, essential native module to work is only oniguruma for TextEditor,  and it wil be able to replace by pure RegExp (of cource I know it has speed problem}.

Atom can support this in the future? If anyone allow it I will refactor so but it looks difficult to touch many files under many pull requests...

My working log is here(dirty commits)
https://github.com/mizchi-sandbox/standalone-atom-editor

data.title: "spawn UNKNOWN" error, and no Packages or Themes loaded at Atom Settings (Windows 7, atom version: 0.169)
data.body:
The "spawn UNKNOWN" error appears on:
- Settings / Updates --> Available updates 
- Settings / Install --> Featured Packages

When I click on "Show output…" nothing shows.

Also it does not show any package in Settings / Packages on Installed Packages, and it shows only "Loading packages..." on Community, Core and Development Packages no matter how long I wait.
In Settings / Themes ---> Community Themes, it shows also "Loading themes..." no matter how long I wait.

I had an old atom version installed with Chocolatey, which I uninstalled before installing the new version with the Windows Installer.

data.title: The new Atom icon doesn't scale down well on Windows
data.body:
The new Atom icon looks very blurry and JPEG-y when viewed in cases where it would be shrunk, like in the top-left of a Windows window.

![blurry atom icon](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4724556/5696386/ffe6ee4a-999c-11e4-8070-12032325dc0d.png)

data.title: Open folder on linux will open a new window, even if first instance is untouched
data.body:
Steps:
Open atom
File - Open folder
select folder
2nd instance of atom is opened

expected behavior: one window open with the new project (windows is doing it like this)

Fedora 21
Atom 0.170.0-29f95b8
